Body: Description: The report generated by PingCastle indicates that Windows LAPS is not deployed on any of the Windows 10 computers (Windows 10 22H2). However, Windows LAPS is indeed deployed on all computers and targets both servers and workstations.

Description Updated: The PingCastle report incorrectly indicates that Windows LAPS is not deployed on any Windows 10 (22H2) computers, despite it being fully deployed across both servers and workstations. The issue appears to be related to how PingCastle processes Windows LAPS vs. Legacy LAPS data.

Steps to Reproduce Updated: Deploy Windows LAPS across multiple systems (Windows 10 22H2, servers, and workstations).
Run a PingCastle Enterprise scan.
Navigate to the LAPS reporting section within the unlocked report.
Observe that the report does not recognize Windows LAPS on Windows 10 devices.
Verify the LAPS Distribution Graph, which does recognize Windows LAPS but does not reflect it in other reporting areas.

What We've Learned Updated: Windows LAPS was not properly included in the analysis.
The "Number of LAPS Installed" metric was designed for Legacy LAPS only.
The Excel export and dashboard pie charts did not factor in Windows LAPS.
The root cause was identified in how Windows LAPS data is retrieved and processed in the reports.

Next Steps Updated: Implemented a fix in a new version to properly detect and differentiate Windows LAPS.
Column adjustments in the report:
Renamed “Number of LAPS Installed” to “Legacy LAPS”.
Added “Microsoft LAPS” column to track Windows LAPS separately.
Introduced a “Combined Total” column summing both values.
Updated pie charts to reflect Windows LAPS data properly.
The issue has been escalated and resolved in the latest release.
